shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) ʾArbaʿtu wängel “Four Gospels” (fols. 3ra-142ra) I-1) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 3ra-40rb) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 3ra-39va) - Stichometry (fol. 39va) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 69 titles (fols. 39vb-40rb) I-2) Gospel of Mark (fols. 41ra-66rb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 41ra-65vb) - Stichometry (fols. 65vb-66ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 45 titles (fols. 66ra-rb) I-3) Gospel of Luke (fols. 67ra-107ra) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 67ra-106rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 69 titles (fols. 106rb-ra) I-4) Gospel of John (fols. 109ra-141vb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 109ra-141va) - Stichometry (fol. 141va) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 18 titles (fols. 141va-vb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: According to Additio 1, priest (qäsis) Täsfa Mikaʾel and priest Wäldä Gabǝr commissioned the Ms. They are also mentioned together with “the children of deacon Nǝwayä Maryam” in the supplication formula on fol. 39va, and with “the children of Mäḥarä Krǝstos” and “the children of Maḫletä Mikaʾel” in the concluding supplication formula on fol. 142ra.

txstates.txstate: The spine cover is torn off. Many fols. are stained with wax. A piece of lacking parchment has been attached by means of leather stitches onto fol. 26. Holes are amended on fols. 6, 14, 25, 43, 45, 49, 54, 59, 62, 94, 95, 98, 121, 122, 130.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament of poor quality on reddish-brown cover (at least 2 tools were used: single line fillet, single circle).

bnothers.bnother: A pair of chains of endband stitches at the remains of the spine cover, close to the head of the codex. A row of holes is visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the tail of the codex. Turn-ins are laced with a cord.

squires.squire: I(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 2; 2, stub after 1/fols. 1r-2v) – II(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪III(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 11r-18v) – ፫IV(5; s.l.: 2, stub after 4/fols. 19r-23v) – [፬]V(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 24r-30v) – ፭VI(8/fols. 31r-38v) – VII(2/fols. 39r-40v) – VIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 41r-48v) – IX(8/fols. 49r-56v) – [n.l.]X(8/fols. 57r-64v) – XI(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before 1/fols. 65r-66v) – XII(6/fols. 67r-72v) – ፪XIII(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 73r-80v) – ፫XIV(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 81r-88v) – XV(8 s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 89r-96v) – XVI(6; s.l.: 2, stub after 4; 5, stub after 1/fols. 97r-102v) – XVII(5; s.l.: 5, stub before 1/fols. 103r-107v) – XVIII(6; s.l.: 3, stub after 4; 4, stub after 3/fols. 108r-113v) – XIX(6; s.l.: 3, stub after 3; 4, stub after 2/fols. 114r-119v) – XX(6/fols. 120r-125v) – XXI(6; s.l.: 2, stub after 4; 5, stub after 1/fols. 126r-131v) – XXII(6; s.l.: 3, stub after 3; 4, stub after 2/fols. 132r-137v) – XXIII(6/fols. 138r-143v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The upper line is written below the ruling on fols. 20, 26, 30, 31, 51, 59-63, 75, 139. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The bottom ruled lined is not used on fols. 55, 57, 59-61v, 91-93, 99, 130r.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the commissioners; a few lines or groups of lines (alternating with black lines) of the incipits of the texts; word mǝʿǝraf; “tituli” written in the upper margins; stichometry; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Only few chapters are numbered, e.g. on fol. 21vb. - Traditional headings of Gospels are not present. - The “tituli” are not numbered.

additional.cont: Fol. 40r: Note on commissioning the writing.
additional.det: The note is written in the main hand, in red. It mentions as the commissioners priest (qäsis) Täsfa Mikaʾel and priest Wäldä Gabǝr.

extras.extra: - An unfinished note on the land possession dated to 1919 year of mercy (= 1926/27 A.D.): fol. 2r. - Lacuna: fol. 102vb. - Scribbles: 124v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of the first fol. of the quire: fols. 11r, 19r, 73r, 81r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts written in the upper margin, in black and in red inks and in pen, in the main and in a secondary hand, e.g.: በጥምቀት: fol. 4va ዘነነዌ: fol. 14va በካዕበ፡ ሰንበት: fol. 32rb በቅዳሜ፡ ሥዑር: fol. 38rb ዘቂርቆስ: fol. 45ra ዘሆሳዕና: fol. 56va. The readings are often separated with a line, e.g., fol. 45ra. - A green thread is inserted in the right upper corner of fol. 16.

miniature.details: Frontispiece miniature. Legend: ወንጌል፡ ዘማቴዎስ፡ “The Gospel of Matthew”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.
Frontispiece miniature. Legend: ወንጌለ፡ ማርቆስ፡ “The Gospel of Mark”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.
Frontispiece miniature. Legend: ወንጌል፡ ዘሉቃስ፡ “The Gospel of Luke”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.
Frontispiece miniature. Legend: ወንጌል፡ ዘዮሐንስ፡ “The Gospel of John”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r (incipit of the Gospel of Matthew): simple coloured (vermilion, yellow) ornamental band; geometric motifs. Fols. 18ra, 21ra: simple and short, coloured (vermilion) ornamental bands; geometric motifs. Fols. 21vb: simple and short, coloured (yellow, black) ornamental bands; geometric motifs. Fol. 108r (incipit of the Gospel of John): elaborate coloured (vermilion, yellow, black) ornamental band with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom and connected by a horizontal band; geometric motifs.
